decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. It also includes cards like Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal to accelerate the combo and cards like Stifle to counter opponent's key plays. The deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible by assembling the combo while also disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on using cheap and efficient spells to control the game while deploying aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Dreadhorde Arcanist. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is built around fetching dual lands to enable casting a variety of spells. Additionally, using cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain helps filter draws and find the necessary cards to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the Bomberman combo of Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate infinite mana, allowing for a powerful win condition such as Walking Ballista. Karn, the Great Creator is also utilized to synergize with artifacts and shut down opponent's artifacts. The deck includes a mix of control elements like Chalice of the Void and disruption with Gyruda, Doom of Depths acting as a companion. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently combo off while controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of using Doomsday to stack the perfect sequence of cards on top of the library, followed by Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the same turn. It uses various control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Will to protect the combo, along with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to help dig for key pieces. The deck also includes mana acceleration in the form of Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly set up the combo.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly using lands like Cloudpost and Glimmerpost to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt opponents' strategies, while Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional utility and card advantage. All Is Dust acts as a board wipe option, and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim offers versatility with its ability to search for lands. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and efficient mana ramping.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers, efficient creatures, and a suite of counterspells to control the game and outvalue opponents. With cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The deck also includes powerful cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards, making it a versatile and adaptable control deck in the Legacy format.

The main concept of the deck revolves around playing aggressively using low-cost spells and creatures to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value from cards like Young Pyromancer and Dreadhorde Arcanist. Delver of Secrets acts as a versatile threat that can quickly close out games. The deck also has strong mana denial capabilities with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to tempo out opponents while maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to slow down the opponent while deploying powerful threats like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic to maintain board presence. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Mother of Runes and Sanctum Prelate, while using efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile. With the help of Aether Vial and Karakas, the deck can quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this Canadian Threshold aggro Legacy deck is to maintain control of the board while applying pressure with early threats like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist. The deck uses countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns provide versatile removal and disruption options. The mana base is built around maximizing the number of blue sources for consistency in casting spells, while also including Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on generating mana with creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Heritage Druid to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Allosaurus Shepherd. It also utilizes cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote to draw cards and keep the combo going. The key strategy is to quickly ramp up mana production and overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures on the board, ultimately finishing the game with a massive attack. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to search for specific creatures needed for the situation.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo - Reanimator deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ox of Agonas using cards like Entomb and Dreadhorde Arcanist, then use reanimation spells such as Reanimate to bring them back into play for a game-winning advantage. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary pieces. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements and includes staple lands like Underground Sea and Volcanic Island.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to deal with threats. The deck also includes card draw and filtering with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sylvan Library. The mana base is designed to support its multicolor requirements and includes utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through powerful planeswalkers and versatile control spells.

The main concept of this Legacy UR Aggro deck is to quickly amass a board presence through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Daze, Flusterstorm, and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to dig for the necessary pieces and maintain card advantage. Lightning Bolt provides additional reach and removal, while Wasteland helps to keep the opponent off of their mana resources. Krark, the Thumbless adds a random element to the deck and can generate additional value from spells cast.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Sprite Dragon, while utilizing efficient spells like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Daze to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its threats. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's colors. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using lands to control the game, with cards like Life from the Loam and Crop Rotation to manipulate the battlefield. It also utilizes Valakut Exploration for card advantage and Punishing Fire for removal. The key strategy is to create a strong land base that can both disrupt the opponent's resources and generate threats like Dark Depths and Field of the Dead. The deck is designed to outvalue and outlast the opponent by leveraging its land-based control elements to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence using efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the game. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents, while using ramp cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to accelerate its own game plan. The deck also includes powerful threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Knight of the Reliquary to pressure opponents and close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck includes versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with opposing threats.
